title: Explained: How to interpret Treynor Ratio in mutual funds
description: The Treynor ratio evaluates mutual fund performance by measuring risk-adjusted returns against market risk, or beta. It's valuable for assessing funds in diversified portfolios and comparing risk management, but doesn’t account for unsystematic risk and assumes a well-diversified portfolio.

There were 12 IPOs in the mainboard segment and 40 in the SME (small and medium enterprise) segment in September.

title: India regards the United States as one of our most reliable trade partners: Piyush Goyal
description: US-India relations are growing in trade, technology, and investment. Union Minister Piyush Goyal emphasized the importance of these ties. Recent MoU on critical minerals, regular trade forums, and high-level meetings highlight this partnership. The focus is also on reskilling technical personnel for AI collaboration. Both nations engage frequently, transcending politics.

title: US port strike to hit Indian textile, pharma, auto part exports, push costs up 3x: GTRI
description: The ongoing strike at 14 major ports in the US is causing significant delays in unloading and processing shipments from India. This impacts goods like textiles, pharmaceuticals, and auto parts. The strike could lead to higher costs and longer transit times for Indian exporters who are already facing challenges. The backlog is expected to increase further.

title: India-US CEO forum: Investment in India’s industrial cities, critical sector tie-ups discussed
description: India and the US discussed potential American investments in 20 upcoming Indian industrial cities. Key areas of collaboration include defence, space, semiconductors, telecom, AI, and clean energy. The discussions aimed at strengthening bilateral cooperation and fostering mutual growth. CEO Forum members also highlighted important sectors to promote entrepreneurship, healthcare, and digital infrastructure.

title: No new anti-profiteering investigations under GST from April 1, 2025
description: From April 1, 2025, new anti-profiteering investigations under GST will cease, allowing businesses to set prices independently. Ongoing cases will continue, with the GST Appellate Tribunal taking over from the Competition Commission of India starting October 1, 2024.

title: GSTN restores July, August 2017 GST returns data
description: The GST Network restored the monthly returns data for July and August 2017 on its portal. This move follows requests from trade and industry for more time to download relevant data before it is archived under the seven-year retention policy. Taxpayers are advised to save necessary data promptly.

title: India jumps 42 spots in 9 years, ranks 39th in Global Innovation Index 2024
description: India has climbed 42 positions in the Global Innovation Index over the past nine years, now ranking first among lower-middle-income economies and 39th globally. This improvement is attributed to Prime Minister Narendra Modi's leadership and the country's focus on fostering innovation. Major cities like Mumbai, Delhi, Bengaluru, and Chennai are among the world's top 100 S&T clusters.

title: Apple faces Indian engineer’s bias lawsuit
description: Anita Nariani Schulze is part of the Sindhi minority. Her complaint alleges that her senior and direct managers, both male, consistently excluded her from meetings while inviting her male counterparts, criticised her, micromanaged her work and deprived her of bonuses, despite positive performance evaluations and significant team contributions.

Most importantly, they should be willing to make the continued investment. It is an uphill race in which there will be winners and losers,” said Deloitte India CEO N Venkatram.

title: One year in, war casts shadow over every aspect of life in Israel
description: One year into the Israel-Hamas war, life in Tel Aviv appears normal with people enjoying outdoor cafes. However, the reality of the conflict remains evident with pictures of hostages and ongoing tensions. The attack by Hamas has deeply affected Israelis, creating feelings of despair and uncertainty about the future amid continuous conflict.

title: Foxconn beats estimates with record Q3 revenue on AI demand
description: Taiwan's Foxconn reported its highest-ever revenue for the third quarter, driven by strong demand for AI servers. The revenue rose 20.2% year on year, reaching T$1.85 trillion. Strong AI server demand boosted its cloud and networking division, while smart consumer electronics saw significant quarter-on-quarter growth. Foxconn expects continued momentum in the fourth quarter.

title: China home sales rise after string of stimulus measures
description: China's home sales increased during the National Day holiday following several property stimulus measures to boost the real estate market. Policy changes included reduced down-payment ratios and mortgage rates. Over 50 cities introduced supportive policies, and nearly 2,000 developments participated in promotions. Visits to projects rose by over 50% year-on-year.

title: Novak Djokovic Retiring? Here's what the tennis star said after father spilled his future plans
description: Novak Djokovic, the 24-time Grand Slam winner, has discussed his post-retirement plans, indicating his intention to stay involved in tennis in various roles. Despite owning properties in different countries, Djokovic plans to return to his home city of Belgrade, Serbia, as revealed by his father. Djokovic expressed his enduring love for the sport.

title: Who is Hashem Safieddine, the likely new chief of Hezbollah, reportedly eliminated by Israel?

Safieddine's status is uncertain as reports suggest he might have survived. Lebanon is preparing for Nasrallah's cremation, while Hezbollah and Lebanese authorities have not confirmed Safieddine’s fate.

title: Assassination attempts and new threats have reshaped how Donald Trump campaigns

His campaign events are now heavily guarded, with heightened security measures and restrictions. Despite the risks, Trump remains committed to campaigning, attributing his survival to divine intervention.

title: Lok Sabha election 2024: Maharashtra get interesting after splits in Shiv Sena, NCP
description: Lok Sabha election 2024: ​​The BJP-Shiv Sena won 41 of the 48 seats in the 2019 polls, but the Sena has split since and a vast majority of the Bal Thackeray-founded party is now allied with the BJP. The Nationalist Congress Party also split as well with Ajit Pawar joining the ruling alliance in the state, led by Eknath Shinde. In the 2019 Lok Sabha polls, the BJP emerged the top party with 23 seats, followed by the undivided Sena with 18.

title: Modi charisma key factor in BJP's bid to retain all 26 seats in Gujarat
description: Gujarat's upcoming Lok Sabha elections are influenced by PM Narendra Modi's charisma, anti-incumbency, unemployment, inflation, education, healthcare challenges, and BJP's endeavor to secure all 26 seats.  ​​Lok Sabha polls in Gujarat will be held in a single phase on May 7. Counting of votes will be held on June 4. Anti-incumbency, unemployment, inflation, education and healthcare facilities are some of the other important issues in the election, where the ruling BJP in Gujarat will attempt to retain all the 26 Lok Sabha seats it won in 2019.

title: Implementation of 'guarantees', decline of BRS favour Congress in Telangana, BJP aiming for better show

The party doubled its vote share to nearly 14 per cent resulting in eight seats in the assembly elections held on November 30, last year. BRS, which ruled the state for about a decade since its emergence, is low on morale following the defeat, even as its founder and former Chief Minister K Chandrasekhar Rao's daughter K Kavitha was arrested on the eve of poll dates announcement, adding insult to the injury.

The incident sparked speculation, but the police confirmed no complaint has been lodged. Banerjee has suffered injuries in the past and is under a "Z+ category" security cover.

Chief Minister Nayab Singh Saini visited Jyotisar temple, Bhupinder Singh Hooda spent time at home, and Abhay Singh Chautala had a day with his grandson. Randeep Singh Surjewala's son visited Kedarnath temple.

description: Richa Ghosh showcased stellar reflexes, executing a remarkable one-handed catch to dismiss Pakistan's captain Fatima Sana during the Women's T20 World Cup match. Despite her previous performance against New Zealand, Ghosh redeemed herself, contributing significantly to India's six-wicket win. Pacer Arundhati Reddy earned Player of the Match for her three wickets.

title: Assam's war on child marriage enters decisive phase: CM starts process of disbursing monthly financial assistance under Nijut Moina Scheme
description: Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma launched the Nijut Moina scheme, offering monthly financial aid to girl students in Assam to combat child marriage and promote higher education. The scheme targets 10 lakh students and mandates regular attendance, good performance, discipline, and remaining unmarried up to PG level.

title: Apple iPhone 16 for Rs 27,000! Reddit user reveals how he got this insane deal with HDFC credit card
description: A Reddit user claimed to have bought the iPhone 16 (256GB) for Rs 27,000 by utilizing credit card reward points, covering the remaining Rs 62,930. Apple's new iPhone 16 series starts at Rs 79,900, with various models and deals available online. The user used 62,930 reward points from an HDFC Infinia card.

Both discussed various topics including free speech and government regulations. Musk created a political action committee supporting Trump, promising efforts to get out the vote in the final stretch of the presidential race.

This preemptive measure ensures women continue to receive their Rs 1500 monthly aid without disruption.

description: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee urged police to register the Kultuli rape-murder case under the POCSO Act. She called for capital punishment for the culprits within three months. Banerjee also emphasised avoiding media trials to ensure proper investigations. She stated that crime has no religion or caste and must be strictly dealt with.

He highlighted the UN's passive role in major global conflicts and pandemics. Jaishankar emphasised India's independent initiatives and alliances such as the IMEC and QUAD. He also noted the geopolitical shifts within the US and India's engagement with the Global South.

Bowlers Arundhati Reddy and Shreyanka Patil delivered strong performances, restricting Pakistan to 105/8. India now needs to win their remaining group stage matches against Sri Lanka and Australia to advance.

While she acknowledges that her son has made mistakes in his past, she criticizes the accusations as being financially motivated. Her statement comes amidst ongoing federal investigations and lawsuits involving former associates and ex-girlfriends, including Cassie Ventura. The case has gained widespread attention following settlements and mounting accusations.

title: Navratri Colours 2024: Day-wise list of 9 colours, goddess names, and their significance
description: Navratri 2024 Colors: The practice of wearing different colours during Navratri is a form of devotion and reverence to the nine forms of Goddess Durga. Each colour represents the specific qualities of the goddess worshipped on that day and helps devotees align with her energy. Wearing the designated colour is believed to enhance the worshipper’s connection with the goddess and attract her blessings for health, prosperity, and peace.

title: Israel-Hamas conflict: Israeli army releases unseen footage of October 7 attacks
Maldives first, but President Muizzu says 'Won't hurt India's security for China's sake'
description: In his first official state visit to India, Maldives President Mohamed Muizzu reaffirmed the island nation's commitment to India’s security, emphasizing that the Maldives would never undermine its long-standing relationship with New Delhi. Amid concerns over Maldives’ growing ties with China, Muizzu assured that these developments would not jeopardize India's strategic interests. He also highlighted the importance of defence cooperation and the critical role India continues to play in Maldives' development. The visit aims to reset ties that had been strained due to previous diplomatic issues.

title: 23 years of Narendra Modi in public office: What has been achieved and what's still to come
description: Modi marks 23 years in public office today, a journey shaped by reforms, initiatives, and a Viksit Bharat vision for reshaping India's future. From his early days as a three-term Chief Minister of Gujarat to becoming a two-term Prime Minister (now in his third term), Modi has spearheaded transformative changes in key areas like economic reform, sanitation, infrastructure, and environmental conservation.  As we look back, here are some of the most notable and appreciated moments from Modi’s journey in office.

title: RBI monetary policy meeting starts: The script isn't changing?
description: The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) begins its three-day monetary policy meeting amid global economic uncertainties. Analysts believe the repo rate will remain unchanged for a 10th consecutive time at 6.50% as the central bank balances inflation control with economic growth.

title: Karachi Airport blast: At least 3 killed in explosion; Pakistan's Baloch Army claims responsibility
RG Kar Rape: 'No one can prove our demands are wrong...,' say West Bengal doctors on hunger strike
description: Junior doctors in Kolkata have started an indefinite hunger strike over the RG Kar rape and murder case, demanding justice and reforms in medical college committees. They accuse state authorities of obstructing their protest and are calling for increased police protection and the removal of the health secretary.

title: In one year of war, Israel strikes 40,000 Hamas targets in Gaza
description: Over the past year, Israel has conducted extensive military operations in response to Hamas-led attacks, destroying thousands of targets and rocket launcher sites in Gaza. The conflict has resulted in significant casualties, including the deaths of 726 Israeli soldiers and nearly 42,000 Palestinians. Additionally, thousands of rockets have been fired into Israel from Gaza, Lebanon, Syria, Yemen, and Iran.

title: US Presidential Elections: Green Party candidate Jill Stein sees 'no lesser evil' between Harris, Trump
description: Arab and Muslim Americans' anger over U.S. support for Israel may impact Kamala Harris's election chances. Green Party candidate Jill Stein says this could lead to a loss of swing states like Michigan and Arizona. Both Harris and Trump are working to gain favor among these voters before the election.

title: China sends 27 military aircraft, six naval vessels towards Taiwan
description: Taiwan’s Ministry of National Defence reported 27 Chinese military aircraft and 6 naval vessels operating around Taiwan from Sunday to Monday morning. 19 of these aircraft crossed the Taiwan Strait median line, prompting Taiwan to monitor and respond. This activity adds to a series of recent provocations by Beijing.

title: Mumbai Metro-3 opens today: Stations, timings, fares, and key details about city's first underground line
description: The Mumbai Metro Line 3, Aqua Line, opens today with a 12.69-km stretch from BKC to Aarey. Inaugurated by Prime Minister Modi, the line features 10 stations and aims to reduce vehicular traffic by 35%, expecting about 4 lakh daily passengers. Services run daily from 6:30 am to 10:30 pm.

title: Ahead of attack anniversary, Netanyahu says, 'we will win'
description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu on Sunday vowed to achieve victory and said his country's military "completely transformed reality" in the year since Hamas's October 7 attack, which has left the country fighting two wars. Over the past 12 months, we have completely transformed reality," Netanyahu said during a visit to the Lebanon border, according to his office.

title: Rajnath Singh to inaugurate DefConnect 4.0 event in Delhi today
description: Union Defence Minister Rajnath Singh will inaugurate DefConnect 4.0 in Delhi to promote indigenous defence innovation. The event, organized by iDEX-DIO under the Ministry of Defence, will bring together armed forces, defence PSUs, innovators, and policymakers. It features a technology showcase, interactive sessions, and discussions on recent budget announcements and semiconductor initiatives.

description: Bihar Deputy Chief Minister Vijay Kumar Sinha said that Rashtriya Janata Dal (RJD) chief Lalu Prasad Yadav is "one of the most corrupt" persons in politics, adding that during his tenure lives of people of the whole country were at stake.

title: RG Kar case: AIIMS Delhi medics to hold candle march on October 9 demanding justice for victim
description: Resident doctors at Delhi AIIMS plan a candle march on October 9 to demand justice for the victim of rape and murder at Kolkata's RG Kar Medical College. AIIMS expresses solidarity with the West Bengal resident doctors who initiated a hunger strike. They call for swift legal action and urge authorities to address the demands of the protesting doctors.

title: Florida braces for Milton, FEMA head slams 'dangerous' Helene misinformation
description: Hurricane Milton, a Category 1 storm, is intensifying in the Gulf of Mexico and is expected to hit Florida's coast, still recovering from Hurricane Helene. Florida has declared a state of emergency, with evacuation orders issued. Misinformation is complicating relief efforts.

title: UK pay growth weakest since February 2021, REC survey show
description: Britain's job market cooled in September with pay growth at its slowest in nearly four years. Permanent job placements continued to decline, though less sharply than in August. Companies face uncertainty ahead of the upcoming annual budget. This easing in pay pressures could support further interest rate cuts by the Bank of England.

title: Donald Trump threatens a 200% tariff on vehicles imported from Mexico
description: Donald Trump promises to impose up to 200% tariffs on vehicles imported from Mexico to support the U.S. auto industry amid a close presidential race against Kamala Harris. This stance draws criticism for potentially raising vehicle costs. Trump also criticizes the Biden administration's response to Hurricane Helene.

title: Heatstroke claims five lives at IAF air show at Marina Beach in Chennai
description: The Indian Air Force (IAF) air show at Chennai's Marina Beach on October 6, 2024, attracted around 15 lakh spectators. However, the scorching heat led to five deaths and many hospitalizations. Despite the dazzling aerobatic displays, heatstroke caused several fainting incidents, overwhelming local medical services. Chennai's public transport systems also struggled to manage the large crowds, and the absence of essential amenities raised concerns about public safety measures.

title: Navratri 2024 Day 5: Significance, puja vidhi, and muhurat timings to celebrate the blessings of Maa Skandamata
description: On the fifth day of Navratri, devotees across India worship Maa Skandamata, the mother of Lord Kartikeya. Representing purity, love, and strength, Maa Skandamata blesses her followers with prosperity and spiritual growth. Devotees perform special rituals, recite prayers, and offer a banana-based bhog to honor her. This article explains the significance of this day, the puja vidhi (ritual), and how worshippers focus their prayers to receive divine blessings from Maa Skandamata.

title: Egypt welcomes French President's call to halt arms exports to Israel
description: France's President Macron urges halting arms exports to Israel citing international law violations in Gaza and Lebanon, causing civilian casualties. Egypt supports this call and demands an immediate ceasefire, valuing France's stance on Palestinian statehood based on the 1967 borders with East Jerusalem as its capital.

title: Kamala Harris talks abortion and more on 'Call Her Daddy' podcast as Democratic ticket steps up interviews
description: Vice President Kamala Harris addresses accusations from Arkansas Governor Sarah Huckabee Sanders, defending her modern family and rejecting outdated views on motherhood. Harris highlights the importance of diverse family structures and appears on several media outlets to discuss reproductive rights and support for her campaign against Trump.

title: Hezbollah rockets hit Israel's Haifa and Tiberias, 10 injured
description: Hezbollah fired rockets at Haifa, causing injuries and damage. Israeli jets responded by striking Hezbollah's intelligence and weapons facilities in Beirut and southern Lebanon. The airstrikes targeted command centers and weaponry stored in residential areas, resulting in secondary explosions. Both sides suffered property damage and minor injuries.

title: Iran air traffic resumes after suspension: state media
description: Iranian authorities announced Monday the resumption of air traffic after flight cancellations at some airports over "operational restrictions", state media reported, as Israel vowed to retaliate for an Iranian missile strike. Iran on Tuesday launched around 200 missiles in its second direct attack on Israel, in what it said was retaliation for the killing of Tehran-aligned militant leaders in the region, along with a general in Iran's Revolutionary Guards.

title: A massive blast outside Karachi Airport in Pakistan kills 2 and injures at least 8
description: A blast outside Karachi Airport killed two and injured eight. Officials report an oil tanker explosion, while the provincial home minister suggests it targeted foreigners, including Chinese nationals involved in China's Belt and Road Initiative. Heavy military deployment ensued, and investigations are ongoing.

title: "Full administrative cooperation was extended": TN Health Minister on IAF's Chennai air show
description: Tamil Nadu Health Minister Ma Subramanian defended the administration's efforts in organizing the Indian Air Force Air Adventure Program at Chennai, countering opposition claims of neglect. He detailed extensive medical and logistical arrangements made, while opposition leaders called it mismanagement, citing fatalities and injuries attributed to heatstroke and crowd control issues.

title: Israel intensifies bombardment of Gaza and southern Lebanon ahead of Oct. 7 anniversary
description: Israel's airstrikes intensified across northern Gaza and southern Lebanon, targeting Hezbollah and related militant groups, resulting in significant casualties and displacement. Concurrently, global reactions include the UK's travel warnings and France's partial arms embargo proposal on Israel amid rising regional tensions.

Players control a PsyCommander, a soldier with psychic powers. The game features online squad-based combat. It will be available on Meta Quest and PlayStation VR2 in October 2024.

description: Maharashtra aims to become the first Indian state to produce 50% of its energy from non-traditional sources by 2030, according to Deputy Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis. The state approved 20,000 megawatts of solar projects in two-and-a-half years, with Avaada Electro Pvt Ltd investing Rs 14,000 crore in a new facility in Nagpur.

description: Pakistani cricketer Raza Hassan is set to marry Indian woman Pooja Boman in January 2025. They got engaged in New York and plan to hold the wedding next year. Pooja will convert to Islam before the marriage. This joins a list of other Pakistani cricketers who married Indian women, including Shoaib Malik and Hasan Ali.

The talks emphasized key areas such as digital connectivity and economic cooperation. India continues to support the Maldives with budgetary assistance and infrastructure development, further cementing their longstanding relationship. Muizzu's visit is part of a broader effort to reset ties after his earlier anti-India stance.

title: US economy now faces 15% risk of entering recession
description: Goldman Sachs lowered the chances of a U.S. recession to 15% due to positive job data. The unemployment rate dropped, and job gains increased in September. The Federal Reserve's rate cuts are also considered. However, concerns remain about rising bad debts in the motor-vehicle lending market, especially among subprime borrowers.

title: J&K elections: Urge INDIA bloc, PDP and others to unite and not form govt till we achieve statehood, says Engineer Rashid
description: As assembly election results loom, Awami Ittehad Party President Sheikh Abdul Rashid urges the INDIA bloc, PDP, Apni party, and others to unite and refrain from forming a government until statehood is restored, emphasizing collective pressure on the Union government.

title: Japan admits to customarily editing 'untidy' cabinet photo
description: Japan's government acknowledged editing an official photo of the new cabinet after internet users mocked their unkempt appearance. The changes aimed to improve the presentation of Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba and Defence Minister Gen Nakatani. Government spokesman Yoshimasa Hayashi defended the practice, calling it customary. Similar incidents involving photo manipulation have occurred globally.

title: Why is social media turning into favourable destination for traffickers?
description: Two underage girls from West Bengal were lured and trafficked through social media, later rescued by NGO Shakti Vahini in Delhi. The traffickers gained their trust by pretending to offer love and marriage. Increased awareness and education on cyber-enabled human trafficking is essential to combat this issue.

title: Elon Musk, world's richest man, is offering $47 to every person who signs this petition
description: Elon Musk's Elon's America PAC is offering $47 to registered voters who refer others to sign a petition supporting the First and Second Amendments. The goal is to get one million signatures in key swing states by October 21. Musk claims Trump is essential for preserving democracy and criticizes Democrats for threatening free speech and gun rights.

title: God with AAP, no need to be scared: Kejriwal after ED raids on party MP
description: AAP leader Arvind Kejriwal stated that "God is with the Aam Aadmi Party" and urged party members not to fear amid ongoing searches by the Enforcement Directorate (ED) linked to Rajya Sabha MP Sanjeev Arora in a money laundering investigation. During a press conference, Kejriwal accused the BJP-led central government of targeting his party through its agencies under the guise of a corruption probe.

Many commenters appreciated the serene interaction and the monkey's response to the spiritual chants.

title: Ratan Tata hospitalised in Mumbai's Breach Candy Hospital

title: Russian stealth drone crashes in Ukraine: Here's the mystery behind the falling S-70 Okhotnik drone
description: In a significant setback for Russia's drone warfare capabilities, an S-70 Okhotnik stealth drone was downed over eastern Ukraine on October 5, 2024. Initial reports speculated Ukrainian involvement, but Russian sources confirmed it was a friendly fire incident. The advanced drone, which serves as a "wingman" for the Su-57 fighter, was shot down during a test flight. This loss highlights both the growing challenges in Russia's drone operations and its ongoing struggle with communication and coordination in the war.

title: Shardiya Navratri 2024: 8 beautiful flowers to offer Maa Durga

This snowfall, combined with rainfall in the plains, has led to a temperature drop. The Meteorological Centre forecasts scattered rain over the next 48 hours, with another round of snowfall possible in higher elevations, further lowering temperatures.

title: Chennai Air Show: How largest ever crowd, 15 lakh people at Marina Beach, turned glorious into nightmare
description: An airshow at Chennai's Marina Beach caused five deaths and several hospitalizations due to extreme heat. The event was part of the Indian Air Force's 92nd-anniversary celebrations and attracted a record crowd of 15 lakh people. The situation prompted a brief protest when gates were locked at the Commissionerate for Differently Abled Welfare.

title: Haryana and J&K Assembly Election 2024: As results near, BJP faces uncertain future in Haryana and J&K
Delhi riots 2020: HC to hear bail pleas of Umar Khalid, Sharjeel Imam in UAPA case on Nov 25
description: Delhi High Court will hear bail pleas of Umar Khalid and Sharjeel Imam on November 25. They are accused under UAPA in a case tied to the February 2020 communal riots. The pleas of other co-accused will also be heard. Previous bail pleas were denied by lower courts. Khalid was arrested in September 2020, Imam in August 2020.

title: Married 15 times, treated as slave: Indonesian woman explains why she opted for 'illegal' pleasure marriage
description: Young women in Indonesian villages are entering short-term marriages with male tourists from the Middle East for money. These temporary unions are arranged by agencies. Women often face mistreatment and economic hardships. The practice, known as pleasure marriages, is illegal in Indonesia. These marriages have sparked widespread condemnation online and raised ethical concerns.

title: Animal lover? 8 exciting career options for you
description: Explore 8 rewarding career options for animal lovers, from veterinary work to wildlife biology, and turn your passion into a profession.

title: Central banks may scale back gold purchases in 2024, reports World Gold Council
description: Central banks are expected to purchase less gold in 2024 compared to 2023, when they bought 1,037 tonnes. August saw the lowest net purchases since March, with significant activity from Poland, Turkey, and India. Although overall demand has decreased, emerging market central banks remain active buyers.

title: Actor Sidhique questioned by Special Investigation Team over rape allegations
description: Malayalam actor Sidhique is being questioned by the Special Investigation Team regarding a rape accusation filed by a female actor. She claims he assaulted her under the guise of offering a film role. Sidhique, granted interim protection by the Supreme Court, is charged under Sections 376 and 506 of the IPC.

title: Tips, overtime, social security: A look at Donald Trump's no-tax pledges and what they might cost
description: Donald Trump pledges to eliminate taxes on tips, Social Security, and overtime pay, promising economic growth to offset potential budget shortfalls. He also advocates lowering corporate tax rates, removing the state and local tax deduction cap, and enacting higher tariffs on imports to boost U.S. manufacturing.

title: Kazakhstan votes to construct its first ever nuclear power plant
description: Kazakhstan held a national referendum on October 6 about constructing a nuclear power plant. Voter turnout was high, with regions like Kyzylorda and Turkistan showing significant participation. Almaty recorded the lowest turnout. The referendum results are important for Kazakhstan's future energy plans and have sparked debates on environmental safety and energy reliance.

title: Complete mismanagement: AIADMK's Kovai Sathyan slams DMK on Chennai Air Show chaos
description: AIADMK leader Kovai Sathyan criticized CM MK Stalin over the mismanagement at the IAF air show in Chennai, which resulted in 5 deaths and over 200 hospitalizations due to excessive heat. Tamil Nadu Health Minister Ma Subramanian confirmed the fatalities and stated precautionary measures were advised prior to the event.

title: "A law abiding citizen, will cooperate," says AAP MP Sanjeev Arora as agencies search premises
description: Aam Admi Party MP Sanjev Arora confirmed premises searches by agencies, asserting full cooperation without knowing the reason. AAP leaders, including Sanjay Singh and Manish Sisodia, criticized BJP for allegedly fabricating cases and using raids to target the party and its members continuously.

title: A Pakistani separatist group claims bombing that killed 2 Chinese near Karachi airport
description: A bombing by the Baloch Liberation Army targeted a convoy of Chinese nationals near Karachi airport, killing two Chinese workers and wounding eight others. The attack highlights ongoing threats against foreign workers in Pakistan, days before a critical Shanghai Cooperation Organization summit.

title: Tomato prices hit Rs 100 again: Here's why prices have skyrocketed in just a week
description: Tomato prices have surged to Rs100-120 per kg in Nagpur due to unseasonal rains and a virus attack in Nashik, reducing supply. Farmers cite reduced tomato cultivation area and crop damage. However, some are profiting from the high prices. The situation is expected to stabilize in a month with fresh supply from Western Nashik.

title: Maldives President Muizzu accorded ceremonial reception at Rashtrapati Bhavan
description: President Mohamed Muizzu of Maldives received a ceremonial reception at Rashtrapati Bhavan in New Delhi. He and First Lady Sajidha Mohamed paid tribute at Rajghat. Muizzu is on a five-day bilateral visit to India. He is set to hold talks with Prime Minister Modi and meet External Affairs Minister S. Jaishankar to discuss bilateral relations.

title: Bastar, Chhattisgarh: 22 out of 31 Naxals killed in Abujhmad encounter have been identified
US-based Hindu group challenges VP Kamala Harris' alleged ties with 'anti-India' Asif Mahmood of Pakistani origin
description: A US-based Hindu political group has raised concerns over Kamala Harris’s connections with Pakistani-American Asif Mahmood from the USCIRF. The group fears this relationship may influence her stance on sensitive issues, including Kashmir. This comes after the USCIRF released a critical report on religious freedom in India, which the Indian government has condemned.

title: The Israel-Hamas war that won't end: How Oct. 7 sparked a year of conflict
description: The Israel-Hamas war, ongoing for a year with heavy casualties, has displaced millions on both sides. The conflict magnifies internal divisions in Israel, while Hamas's guerrilla tactics and survival strategy challenge Israel's military goals. Diplomatic efforts for a truce have consistently failed.

title: What is 'Aavati Kalay'? Watch PM Modi's newly composed melody for Maa Durga
description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi shared a garba he wrote in tribute to Maa Durga for Navratri. He expressed gratitude to singer Purva Mantri for her rendition. Modi also extended Navratri greetings to the nation, hoping for Maa Durga’s blessings for everyone. Navratri, a significant Hindu festival, celebrates Goddess Durga and her nine forms with devotion and joy.

title: Madonna's brother Christopher Ciccone dies due to cancer. "Hard to explain our bond", says singer
description: Christopher Ciccone, Madonna's brother, passed away at 63 after battling cancer. Ciccone, an artist and designer, played significant roles in Madonna's early career, directing tours and designing her homes. Although their relationship was strained, Madonna paid tribute to their unique bond, praising his talents and character. He is survived by his husband Ray Thacker.

title: Next Warren Buffett? 26-year-old Meerut investor's matrimonial ad claims Rs 29 LPA and growing. Internet can’t believe it
description: A 26-year-old investor from Meerut has gone viral for a matrimonial ad claiming his Rs 29 lakh income grows 54% annually. He offers a PowerPoint on safe investing, sparking both amusement and skepticism online, with many doubting the realism of his financial claims.

title: Shah Rukh Khan to Beyoncé: 7 stars with their own private islands
description: These seven celebrities, including SRK and Jacqueline Fernandez, own private islands, offering unmatched privacy, luxury, and stunning natural beauty.

title: Two Chinese workers, others killed in explosion outside Karachi Airport; China calls it a 'terrorist attack'
description: A tanker explosion outside Karachi Airport killed two Chinese workers and injured at least eight, including Pakistani casualties. Authorities suspect a targeted attack against foreigners, calling it a terrorist act. The blast caused extensive damage, prompting both nations to call for a thorough investigation.

title: India, UAE investment promotion, protection treaty comes into effect from Aug 31: FinMin
description: The bilateral investment treaty signed between India and the UAE, enforced from August 31, 2024, ensures investment protection continuity following the expiration of the previous agreement. It sets provisions for arbitration, defines investment protections, and balances investor rights with state regulations, promoting increased bilateral investments.

title: Haunting Image From Gaza Went Viral As Israel Responded To October 7 Attack
description: Abu Maamar has also lost her sister, along with her four children in an airstrike in northern Gaza.

title: "Sanjoy Roy Raped, Murdered Kolkata Doctor": CBI Chargesheet In RG Kar Case
description: The Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) has charged Sanjoy Roy, who used to work with Kolkata Police as a contractual staff, with the rape and murder of an on-duty woman doctor at the RG Kar Medical College and Hospital.

description: PM Modi had become the Chief Minister of Gujarat for the first time on October 7, 2001.

title: Book Excerpt | When A 10-Year-Old Sachin Tendulkar Sneaked Into Wankhede
description: Exactly ten Novembers ago, Tendulkar played his final match for India, in a farewell Test series culminating on this very ground in Wankhede Stadium. Today, he is fifty years of age, yet the aura about him hasn't diminished.

description: The couple had only watched their wedding video once before it was misplaced.

title: Have no objections: Farooq Abdullah on taking rival PDP's support for govt formation
description: Ahead of the vote counting, National Conference president Farooq Abdullah expressed openness to collaborating with Mehbooba Mufti's PDP to form a government in Jammu and Kashmir. He criticized the move to empower the Lieutenant Governor to nominate members for five reserved seats in the Assembly and threatened to approach the Supreme Court if the BJP-led Centre proceeds with it.

title: Tomato Price: Here’s how and where to get tomatoes at Rs 65/kg in Delhi, Noida, Gurgaon, Faridabad
description: The Indian government is selling tomatoes at Rs 65 per kg through mobile vans to control rising prices. Unseasonal rains in Maharashtra have damaged crops, leading to price hikes. A price stabilization fund is being used to manage costs. Farmers and traders report delayed sowing and increased pest issues affecting tomato supply.

title: Ladwa Haryana Assembly Elections 2024: BJP's Nayab Singh vs. Congress's Mewa Singh, all you need to know
description: Anticipation is growing in Haryana as the result day for the state's 90-member Assembly approaches. Ladwa Assembly seat is a major focus. Notable candidates include BJP's Chief Minister Nayab Singh Saini and Congress' Mewa Singh Singroha. The seat's outcome will be a key indicator of Haryana's electoral fortunes.

title: BJP playing 'desperate games' to engineer majority in J-K: Congress
description: A day before Assembly poll results, Congress accused BJP of attempting to undermine the people’s mandate favoring their alliance with the National Conference in Jammu and Kashmir. Congress leader Jairam Ramesh claimed BJP is using desperate tactics and exercising power maliciously to negate the democratic process.

title: India ‘first responder’ for Maldives: PM Modi meets Prez Muizzu, promises to strengthen ties
Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine: Who are Victor Ambros and Gary Ruvkun?
description: The 2024 Nobel Prize for Physiology or Medicine has been awarded to Victor Ambros and Gary Ruvkun for their discovery of microRNA and its role in post-transcriptional gene regulation. This groundbreaking work has revealed a new principle of gene regulation essential for multicellular organisms, including humans, with the human genome coding for over a thousand microRNAs.

title: Who are Pakistan's ethnic militants behind attack near Karachi airport?
description: Two Chinese nationals died in an explosion near Karachi's international airport. The Baloch Liberation Army claimed responsibility, targeting Chinese citizens. This comes amid recent attacks focusing on Chinese interests in Pakistan, especially infrastructure projects in Balochistan. The incident occurs ahead of the Shanghai Cooperation Organisation summit in Islamabad, raising security concerns.

title: Haryana Assembly Elections 2024: Julana, Ladwa, Garhi, Uchana Kalan, and 6 other key seats that could decide state's fate
description: Haryana Election 2024: Haryana awaits the results of its 15th legislative assembly election. Exit polls favor Congress, but BJP hopes for a third term. Notable contests include Julana with wrestler candidates, Sohna with strong independents, and Ladwa with the Chief Minister's seat at stake. These key races could shape Haryana’s political future.

title: Nobel Prize 2024 in Medicine goes to Victor Ambros and Gary Ruvkun for discovery of microRNA
description: Victor Ambros and Gary Ruvkun have been awarded the 2024 Nobel Prize for Physiology or Medicine for their discovery of microRNA and its role in post-transcriptional gene regulation. The prize follows the 2023 award to Katalin Karikó and Drew Weissman for groundbreaking mRNA vaccine research.

title: 'Padhne wale kahi bhi padh lete hai': Viral garba video of book-reading dancer takes over social media
description: A viral video shows a man dancing garba while reading a book during Navratri celebrations. Dressed in a brown kurta and jeans, he never looks away from the book. Social media users are amused by his unique combination of study and dance, speculating he might be preparing for a competitive exam.

title: Environment takes centre stage as global summits loom
description: Global environmental challenges such as global warming, biodiversity loss, desertification, and plastic pollution will be the focus of upcoming United Nations sessions. Key conferences include biodiversity in Colombia, climate change in Azerbaijan, desertification in Saudi Arabia, and plastic pollution in South Korea. These meetings aim to secure significant agreements and strategies to address the urgent threats facing our planet.

title: Government to sell tomatoes at Rs 65/kg
description: The government has begun selling tomatoes at Rs 65 per kg through mobile vans and retail outlets to curb soaring prices due to unseasonal rains damaging crops in key areas. October saw a 39% price rise, affecting home-cooked meals. This intervention falls under the price stabilisation fund to manage market rates effectively.

title: Asteroid may become new wonder-food for astronauts, claims new study
description: A study published in The International Journal of Astrobiology reveals a groundbreaking concept where astronauts could use asteroids to meet their nutritional needs. While the carbon from asteroids may be transformed into edible biomass, extensive testing is still required to ensure its safety. This new approach offers hope for addressing the challenge of food scarcity during long-duration space missions, though significant hurdles remain before it can be realized.

title: Human-caused bird extinctions reduced diversity in functions, unique history, study finds
description: A study led by the University of Birmingham reveals that human-induced bird extinctions over 1,30,000 years have dramatically reduced birds' functional diversity and resulted in a loss of three billion years of unique evolutionary history. Approximately 600 species, including the Dodo and Kaua'i 'o'o, have disappeared, affecting ecological roles like pollination and seed dispersal. This underscores the urgent need for targeted global conservation strategies.

title: Sean 'Diddy' Combs forced minors to perform oral sex, told them...: Lawyer makes explosive claim
description: Hip-hop mogul Sean 'Diddy' Combs faces serious legal accusations of sex trafficking and racketeering. Attorney Tony Buzbee claims 120 individuals, including 25 minors, have accused Combs of assault. Combs has pleaded not guilty and remains in jail. His attorney and mother have defended him, asserting his innocence while the legal process unfolds.

title: World's rivers faced the driest year in three decades in 2023, the UN weather agency says
description: 2023 marked the driest year in over three decades, with record-high temperatures contributing to severe droughts and reduced river flows, according to the U.N. weather agency. Glaciers feeding global rivers also saw the largest mass loss in 50 years, threatening water security for millions.

title: Can Congress' win in Jatland revive grand old party in North India?
description: Haryana Assembly Election 2024: The CVoter exit poll has predicted a Congress victory in the Haryana Assembly elections, suggesting the party will win 50–58 seats out of the 90-member assembly. If realized, this victory would be a significant milestone for Congress, which has been struggling to regain power in several states. The win is expected to provide a much-needed boost for the INDIA bloc ahead of upcoming elections in other states, while also signalling a shift in political dynamics in Haryana, a crucial agricultural state.

title: Hello China, bye India? Why Chinese stock rally is not convincing investors
description: India's stock markets experienced significant losses as foreign investors shifted focus to Chinese equities, driven by China's recent stimulus measures. However, analysts remain skeptical about the sustainability of the Chinese stock rally, citing structural economic issues and potential overvaluation concerns.

title: "Agencies are being misused" says Tejaswi Yadav after getting bail in land for job case
description: Former Bihar Deputy Chief Minister Tejaswi Yadav, his father Lalu Prasad Yadav, and his brother Tej Pratap Yadav have been granted bail in the Land for Job money laundering case. The court required them to submit passports and not leave the country. The next hearing is set for October 25.

title: RG Kar rape and murder row: CBI files chargesheet in West Bengal trainee doctor's case
description: The Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) has submitted a chargesheet in the rape and murder case of a trainee doctor at RG Kar Medical College, reported PTI, citing officials. The names included in the chargesheet have not been disclosed yet. Meanwhile, tensions continue to rise in West Bengal.

title: Commerce department proposes solutions for exporters' credit crisis
description: The commerce department is addressing exporters' credit issues by exploring options like a credit guarantee fund for export finance. Export credit has decreased despite a rise in exports, causing concern. The directorate general of foreign trade is involving EY for analysis. The Export Credit Guarantee Corporation's limited coverage and the need for factoring services are also being reviewed.

title: UKPNP condemns targeted killings of Kashmiris in Pakistan amid rising violence
description: The UKPNP condemned the targeted killings of Kashmiris in Pakistan, specifically highlighting the recent murder of Chaudhry Danish. They urged international intervention and emphasized Pakistan's responsibility to uphold human rights, stressing the need for justice and safety for Kashmiris in Pakistan and PoJK.

title: 5 die due to Chennai heat during IAF’s Mega Air Show in Marina Beach
5 die due to Chennai heat during IAF’s Mega Air Show in Marina Beach
Indian farmers get just one-third of the price we pay for fruits and vegetables
description: Indian farmers earn only about one-third of the final selling price for fruits and vegetables. Research suggests enhancing private markets, using e-NAM, and promoting farmer collectives to address this. Building cold storage and improving processing capacities are also advised. For dairy and poultry sectors, creating feed banks and promoting artificial insemination can boost productivity.

title: Russia seeks to boost coal exports to India
description: Russia is keen to boost coal exports to India to meet the growing demand for the fuel, according to Deputy Prime Minister Alexander Novak. While China currently leads in Russian coal imports, India is expected to surpass it by the end of the decade as Beijing reduces coal usage for power generation.

title: Sanath Jayasuriya named as full-time Sri Lanka cricket head coach
description: Sanath Jayasuriya was appointed Sri Lanka cricket head coach on Monday, replacing Chris Silverwood who quit following the country's early exit from the T20 World Cup. Former Sri Lanka captain Jayasuriya was regarded as one of the greatest one-day international batsmen of all time and was pivotal in the 1996 World Cup victory.

title: Maldives comes back to India, after rubbing shoulders with the Dragon
description: Maldives President Mohamed Muizzu, a pro-China leader is on his first bilateral visit to India since taking office, seeking to repair relations amid the country's ongoing economic crisis. His campaign previously focused on reducing Indian influence, but he has recently softened his stance, acknowledging India's potential support.

title: Man faces charge in death of fellow inmate at Toronto jail
description: A man serving time at a Toronto jail is facing a new criminal charge after the death of a fellow inmate.
